Articles.Content: Is there any role in the backup mission controllers needed that does not require a mic ?

11 minutes ago, Gaarst said:

Is there any role in the backup mission controllers needed that does not require a mic ?

Aside from flight planner or assisting with code/mathematics, or making RSS/RO boosters, no. You require one of these things:

  • Skype (so we can chat outside of the forum)(microphone not required while only discussing)(we typically only use the text chat portion unless in a launch).
  • Lots of time
  • Ability to do advanced college level math
  • Knowledge how to code in kOS.
  • Able to build boosters in a RSS/RO for us
  • Assist with Flight Planning and coordination

Having made this, I will add this to the OP.
OP has been updated with a list of what you will need to join depending on how you want to help.

1 hour ago, adsii1970 said:

[MISSION RELATED] What is the next mission going to be? Is it going to be a satellite, another Kerbaled orbiter, or space station component?

[MISSION RELATED]

It's going to be one of a few different things- either:

  1. A geostationary communications sattilite
  2. Scorpius-Solaris 02
  3. Moon flyby and return probe
  4. Other proposed missions

One important consideration before any new launches is to update the game to 1.1.2, or the newest version of RO.

1 hour ago, Gaarst said:

Is there any role in the backup mission controllers needed that does not require a mic ?

In the backup mission controllers? I don't think so. However, FDO in particular might want some help planning orbital maneuvers. If you wanted to be on-station during a launch, I'm sure that he or she would love your help.

Also, we have a mission planning team, too. Talk to @ILikeIke if you're interested.

Edited May 12, 2016 by Dman979

5 minutes ago, Dman979 said:

Scorpius-Solaris 02

Nope.  Remember that we aren't doing manned launches for a bit.

32 minutes ago, Andem said:

Crap... does the mic, thing apply to me? I don't have a mic, and Skype always breaks after a couple minutes on my computer.

Actually, you probably won't need one if all you're doing is writing press releases. A word of warning, though- make --> very sure <--not to get into roleplay. That is Verboten.

If your computer has a built-in mike, then that should be fine on Discord, which we used for the last launch. If you want to provide in-flight commentary with @CliftonM, that's what you'll use.

Edited May 12, 2016 by Dman979

BUT! It seems as if discord includes a chat function, so we could use that (potentially, depends on what the others decide).

2 hours ago, ZooNamedGames said:

Aside from flight planner or assisting with code/mathematics, or making RSS/RO boosters, no. You require one of these things:

  • Skype (so we can chat outside of the forum)(microphone not required while only discussing)(we typically only use the text chat portion unless in a launch).
  • Lots of time

  • Knowledge how to code in kOS.

Having made this, I will add this to the OP.

  • I could do the Skype thing though I would prefer Discord (I can make an effort)
  • I don't have lots of time right now because of exams, but things should get better past next week
  • I can do maths, that's not a problem
  • I am really bad at kOS
  • I can build rockets
  • I probably can assist on stuff depending on what I need to do

 

@Dman979, about FDO thing, who do I need to contact ?

 

And for the planning team, @ILikeIke, could you explain briefly what you do and how I could help ?

I think you guys should have a launch commentator. Someone who does the countdown and talks about stuff regarding the rocket. I heard liftoff 6 different times on the last stream, you definitely need a launch commentator. I'm not up for it, find someone to do it.

@Kerbiter we have a Public Affairs Officer who's responsible for providing comments on live streams and videos. I have not yet seen the most recent launch attempt video since I was there so I'll have to take a look at it. 

@Gaarst because we haven't had to do orbital maneuvers yet we haven't had a whole lot of work to do in terms of flight planning. But what I and two other people I'm working with want to do is basically plan out maneuver nodes in advance of the entire flight, inasmuch as that's possible. FDO in my mind is responsible for keeping track of where our spacecraft have been, are, and where they're going and also monitor all OMS firings. 

Edited May 13, 2016 by ILikeIke

Well good for you. But at least you need only one person to say "liftoff".

4 minutes ago, the_pazter said:

can we change FDO to its real Apollo name, FIDO ( Fy-Doh) its a little more pleasant to the tongue than FDO

Really, FDO is the real name of it, and mission controllers still refer to it pronounced like FIDO.  No need for a change.

@Andem, @KAL 9000

The primary useofs  a microphone is used by mission controllers to communicate to each other during missions, the mission PAO to telecast the stream, and the Astronaut to speak to the CAPCOM. If you don't fit into these roles, the usage of vocal communication is completely optional. We use discord's built in chat client primarily during missions, but otherwise would use Skype for the majority of text communication. We use discord for all the mission controllers, with the CAPCOM and the Astronaut being on a separate VoIP utility.

Given your statements of not using a microphone, we have several groups that don't necessarily overlap with the above, though due to our membership some of our members serve multiple roles. That said, we can always use more hardware (payload/launch vehicle) developers, software developers (using kOS), press corps (press report releasers), and mission planners (flight trajectory and geometry nerds). Feel free to contact @ZooNamedGames if you're interested in any capacity.
